title: Process Orbitrap Iso Data
text: goal isoorbi R package help process isotopocule measurements Orbitrap Iso mass spectrometer. expects .isox files created IsoX input.

title: Process Orbitrap Iso Data
code: # To install from CRAN install.packages("isoorbi")

title: Process Orbitrap Iso Data
code: library(isoorbi)  orbi_read_isox(filepath)

title: Process Orbitrap Iso Data
text: encounter clear bug, please file issue minimal reproducible example GitHub. questions discussion, please use isoorbi slack workspace.

title: Process Orbitrap Iso Data
text: get bug fix use latest features, install development version isoorbi GitHub.
code: # install the development version  install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("isoverse/isoorbi")

what: isoorbi: Process Orbitrap Iso Data — isoorbi-package
title: isoorbi: Process Orbitrap Iso Data — isoorbi-package
text: First generation tool process data Orbitrap Iso mass spectrometers. Citation: doi:10.1021/acs.analchem.1c00944 .

title: isoorbi: Process Orbitrap Iso Data — isoorbi-package
text: Maintainer: Caj Neubauer caj.neubauer@colorado.edu (ORCID) [copyright holder] Authors: Sebastian Kopf sebastian.kopf@colorado.edu (ORCID) Kristýna Kantnerová kristyna.kantnerova@colorado.edu (ORCID)

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
text: Ratio calculation isotopocules base peak defined orbi_define_basepeak(). Please note well: formula used calculate ion ratios matters! simply use arithmetic mean. best option may depend type data processing (e.g., MS1 versus M+1 fragmentation).

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
code: orbi_calculate_ratios(   numerator,   denominator,   ratio_method = c("mean", "sum", "median", "geometric_mean", "slope", "weighted_sum") )

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
text: numerator Column(s) used numerator; contains ion counts denominator Column used denominator; contains ion counts ratio_method Method computing ratio

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
text: Calculated ratio isotopocules defined numerator(s) denominator, using one ratio methods.

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
text: Description options ratio_method: mean: arithmetic mean ratios individual scans. sum: sum ions numerator across scans divided sum ions observed denominator across scans. geometric_mean: geometric mean ratios individual scans. slope: ratio calculated using slope obtained linear regression model weighted numerator x, using stats::lm(x ~ y + 0, weights = x). weighted_sum: derivative sum option. weighing function ensures scan contributes equal weight ratio calculation, .e. scans ions Orbitrap contribute disproportionately total sum x y used calculate x/y.

title: Calculate isotopocule ratios — orbi_calculate_ratios
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>%                      orbi_simplify_isox() %>%                      orbi_define_basepeak(base_peak = "M0") #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_define_basepeak() is setting the M0 isotopocule as the ratio denominator... ratio <- orbi_calculate_ratios(numerator = df$ions.incremental,                           denominator = df$basepeak_ions,                          ratio_method =  "sum")

what: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
title: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
text: orbi_define_basepeak() sets one isotopocule data frame base peak (ratio denominator)

title: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
code: orbi_define_basepeak(dataset, base_peak)

title: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
text: dataset tibble IsoX output. Needs contain columns filename, compound, scan., isotopocule, ions.incremental. base_peak isotopocule gets assigned base peak, .e. denominator calculate ratios

title: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
text: Input data frame plus two columns called basepeak basepeak_ions

title: Define and assign the base peak — orbi_define_basepeak
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>%                      orbi_simplify_isox() %>%                      orbi_define_basepeak(base_peak = "M0") #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_define_basepeak() is setting the M0 isotopocule as the ratio denominator...

what: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
title: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
text: basic filter function orbi_filter_isox() file names, isotopocules, compounds time ranges

title: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
code: orbi_filter_isox(   dataset,   filenames = "all",   compounds = "all",   isotopocules = "all",   time_min = "all",   time_max = "all" )

title: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
text: dataset IsoX data filtered filenames Vector file names keep; also accepts "" compounds Vector compounds keep; also accepts "" isotopocules Vector isotopocules keep; also accepts "" time_min Minimum retention time minutes (time.min) time_max Maximum retention time minutes (time.min)

title: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
text: Filtered tibble

title: Basic generic filter for IsoX data — orbi_filter_isox
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>% orbi_simplify_isox() %>% orbi_filter_isox(filenames = c("s3744"), compounds = c("HSO4-"), isotopocules = "M0", time_min = "all", time_max = "all") #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_filter_isox() is applied to dataset #> Keep filename: s3744 #> Keep compound: HSO4- #> Keep isotopocule: M0 #> No filter for `time_min` applied. #> No filter for `time_max` applied.

what: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
text: Remove minor signals (e.g., satellite peaks) reported IsoX

title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
code: orbi_filter_satellite_peaks(dataset)

title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
text: dataset data frame tibble produced IsoX data orbi_simplify_isox()

title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
text: Filtered data frame (tibble)

title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
text: orbi_filter_satellite_peaks() function removes minor signals isotopocule reported IsoX. often small satellite peaks generated Fourier transform. signal high intensity many signals, can indicate m/z tolerance setting used processing .raw files IsoX incorrect.

title: Filter to remove minor satellite peaks — orbi_filter_satellite_peaks
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>% orbi_simplify_isox() %>% orbi_filter_satellite_peaks() #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_filter_satellite_peaks() is removing minor signals (e.g., satellite peaks) that were reported by IsoX...

what: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
text: function orbi_filter_scan_intensity() removes extremely high low intense scans based TIC x injection time (.e., ion intensity)

title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
code: orbi_filter_scan_intensity(dataset, outlier_percent)

title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
text: dataset Simplified IsoX dataset TICxIT outliers removed outlier_percent number 0 10. Remove percentage scans based TIC multiplied injection time.

title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
text: Filtered tibble

title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
text: Function intended remove scans outliers. TIC multiplied injection time serves estimate number ions Orbitrap. filter basic truncation removes x % scans largest x % scans smallest ion estimates. Grouping columns filename compound. input dataset expected least 8 columns: filename, scan., time.min, compound, isotopocule, ions.incremental, tic, .ms.

title: Filter to remove extreme scans — orbi_filter_scan_intensity
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>% orbi_simplify_isox() %>% orbi_filter_scan_intensity(outlier_percent = 1) #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_filter_scan_intensity() is removing extremely high and low intense scans. A total of 2% of the scans will be removed...

what: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
text: function orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules() removes isotopocules consistently detected scans

title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
code: orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules(dataset, min_percent)

title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
text: dataset simplified IsoX data frame processed min_percent number 0 90. Isotopocule must observed least percentage scans (please note: percentage defined relative commonly observed isotopocule compound)

title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
text: Filtered tibble

title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
text: input dataset expected least 8 columns: filename, scan., time.min, compound, isotopocule, ions.incremental, tic, .ms.

title: Filter to remove weak isotopocules — orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>%                      orbi_simplify_isox() %>%                      orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules(min_percent = 2) #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_filter_weak_isotopocules() is remove isotopocules that are detected in less than 2% of scans (in each grouping)...

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
text: Read IsoX output file (.isox) tibble data frame

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
code: orbi_read_isox(filepath)

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
text: filepath Path .isox file

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
text: tibble containing minimum columns filename, scan., time.min, compound, isotopocule, ions.incremental, tic, .ms

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
text: Additional information columns: filename: name original Thermo .raw file processed IsoX scan.: scan number time.min: acquisition retention time minutes compound: name compound (e.g., NO3-) isotopocule: name isotopocule (e.g., 15N); called isotopolog .isox ions.incremental: estimated number ions, increments since calculated number tic: total ion current (TIC) scan .ms: scan injection time () milli seconds (ms)

title: Read IsoX file — orbi_read_isox
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_DualInlet_small.isox", package="isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_DualInlet_small.isox

title: Simplify IsoX data — orbi_simplify_isox
text: Keep columns directly relevant isotopocule ratio analysis

title: Simplify IsoX data — orbi_simplify_isox
code: orbi_simplify_isox(dataset)

title: Simplify IsoX data — orbi_simplify_isox
text: dataset IsoX data simplified

title: Simplify IsoX data — orbi_simplify_isox
text: tibble containing 8 columns: filename, scan., time.min, compound, isotopocule, ions.incremental, tic, .ms.

title: Simplify IsoX data — orbi_simplify_isox
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package="isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>% orbi_simplify_isox() #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns...

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
text: Contains logic generate results table

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
code: orbi_summarize_results(dataset, ratio_method)

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
text: dataset processed tibble produced IsoX output ratio_method Method computing ratio; passed orbi_calculate_ratios()

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
text: Returns results table containing filename, compound,  basepeak, Isotopocule, ratio, ratio_sem, ratio_relative_sem_permil, shot_noise_permil, ..Scans, minutes_to_1e6_ions

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
text: Description output columns: basepeak: Isotopocule used denominator ratio calculation. isotopocule: Isotopocule used numerator ratio calculation. ratio_sem: Standard error mean ratio number_of_scans: Number scans used final ratio calculation minutes_to_1e6_ions: Time minutes take observe 1 million ions isotopocule used numerator ratio calculation. shot_noise_permil: Estimate shot noise (correctly thermal noise) reported ratio permil. ratio_relative_sem_permil: Relative standard error reported ratio permil

title: Generate the results table — orbi_summarize_results
code: fpath <- system.file("extdata", "testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox", package = "isoorbi") df <- orbi_read_isox(filepath = fpath) %>%       orbi_simplify_isox() %>% orbi_define_basepeak(base_peak = "M0")  %>%       orbi_summarize_results(ratio_method = "sum") #> orbi_read_isox() is loading .isox data from file path:  #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isoorbi/extdata/testfile_Flow_Exploration_small.isox #> orbi_simplify_isox() is applied to dataset .. Will keep only most important columns... #> orbi_define_basepeak() is setting the M0 isotopocule as the ratio denominator... #> orbi_summarize_results() is grouping dataset by columns: filename, compound, basepeak, isotopocule #> orbi_calculate_ratios() is calculating ratios, using the ratio_method: sum #> orbi_summarize_results() is summarizing ratios for the results table...

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports

text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. magrittr %>%
